bill_title: revise certain provisions regarding the liability of a garnishee to a plaintiff after the service of a summons.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions regarding the liability of a garnishee to a plaintiff after the service of a summons. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 21-18-12 be amended to read as follows: 21-18-12. From the time of the service of the summons upon the garnishee he shall stand , the garnishee is liable to the plaintiff to for the amount of the property, money, credits, and effects in his the garnishee's possession or under his the garnishee's control belonging to the defendant, or in which he shall be the garnishee is interested, to the extent of his the garnishee's right or interest therein, and of all debts due or to become due to the defendant, except such as provided in section 2 of this Act or as may be by law exempt from execution. Section 2. That chapter 21-18 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The provisions of § 21-18-12 do not apply if: (1) The summons is delivered upon the garnishee within two business days before the defendant's normal payday for the pay period; (2) The defendant's wages are paid by direct deposit to a financial institution or the garnishee uses an independent contractor as payroll administrator and prior to receiving the summons the garnishee has issued instructions to the financial institution or the payroll administrator to pay the defendant for that pay period; or (3) The State of South Dakota is the garnishee, and prior to receiving the summons the auditor's office has been issued instructions to pay the defendant for that pay period.
